info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 2:09PM CST until November 20 at 5:00PM CST by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Kimble.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM CST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 206 PM CST, radar indicated an area of thunderstorms with very heavy rain, moving east across Kimble County. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches in a short period of time will cause street flooding in Junction, and flooding of low-lying and flood prone areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, Segovia, South Llano River State Park, Telegraph, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line, Cleo, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line, The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290, I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line and Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line. - This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 442 and 477.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River, RM 2291 crossings along Bear Creek, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, RM 385 crossing Perdenales River, US HWY 377 crossing 2 miles North of Telegraph, County Road 430 crossing Joy Creek, KC 451 crossing Johnson Fork, crossings along County Road 410 and KC 314 crossing Llano River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON
